item.title: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

James-RevolutionX:

This could be further developed; a player checking their black marks perhaps?

Just add something in the quest tab like,

under Initialize

add getPA().sendFrame126(“You have: " + BlackMarks + " Black marks.”, ID);

or add a command.

item.title: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system
item.dc:creator: @iDream iDream
item.description:
@iDream wrote:

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:372: cannot find symbol symbol : method toString(int,int,int) location: class java.lang.Integer characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.BlackMarks, 0, In teger.toString(p.BlackMarks).length())); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Thats my error and I can’t figure it out, I’m new at coding so I don’t understand much of it, but I do understand what the code means, just don’t understand the error.

Thanks for the tutorial

Read full topic
item.source: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system

item.title: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system
item.dc:creator: @smkscape smkscape
item.description:
@smkscape wrote:

Easy ‘tutorial’ however:

Shoud be:

And why the try in the command, just use:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("mark") && c.playerRights >= 1) { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.BlackMarks++; c2.sendMessage("You've recieved a black mark from " + c.playerName + "! You now have "+ c2.BlackMarks+"."); c.sendMessage("You have given @red@" + c2.playerName + "@bla@ a blackmark."); if(c2.BlackMarks >= 5) { Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan); Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan); Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true; } } } } }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

[quote=“dakilla255, post:10, topic:386165”][quote author=denhanhan link=topic=481924.msg3530525#msg3530525 date=1300134073]
And actually, None server uses black marks because they are worthless.
If you are dealing with a big rule breaker, you don’t give him a black mark, you just ban him :S
[/quote]

Just Banning someone is corrupt you would give a warning or two if they are like flaming and stuff.[/quote]
“corrupt”? It’s his server, he can do what he wants.

item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

You should further explain the code, as it’s currently snippets.

No, its not snippets.

Would a snippet be telling someone how to add one integer? No. Without the integer another peice of the code will not work, therefor it can’t be a snippet, #facepalm.

Read full topic
item.source: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system

item.title: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system
item.dc:creator: @Rickrolla Rickrolla
item.description:
@Rickrolla wrote:

[quote=“smokin flax, post:1, topic:386165”]Description: How to add up black marks on your [PI] Server
Difficulty: About 2/10
Assumed Knowledge: How to use CTRL+F button, how to paste, copy, etc…

Tested on: Project Insanity
Classes Modified: Commands.java, playersave.java, and player.java.

Okay lets get started, First off you want to open up player.java and find,

And directly above that add,

Next open up, playersave.java and find,

break; case 3: if (token.equals("character-equip")) { p.playerEquipment[Integer.parseInt(token3[0])] = Integer.parseInt(token3[1]); p.playerEquipmentN[Integer.parseInt(token3[0])] = Integer.parseInt(token3[2]); }
and directly above the Break; add,

} else if (token.equals("Black-marks")) { p.BlackMarks = Integer.parseInt(token2); }
Next (same file playersave.java) Find,

and above that, add this where you think it should go.

characterfile.write("Black-marks = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.BlackMarks), 0, Integer.toString(p.BlackMarks).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Next open up your commands.java, and add this command

if (playerCommand.startsWith("mark") && c.playerRights >= 1) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.BlackMarks++; c2.sendMessage("You've recieved a black mark from " + c.playerName + "! You now have "+ c2.BlackMarks+"."); c.sendMessage("You have given @red@" + c2.playerName + "@bla@ a blackmark."); if(c2.BlackMarks >= 5) { Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan); Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan); Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true; } } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Online."); } }
And i believe thats it, if i missed anything or if you have errors post them below,
Also this my first tutorial ever.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system

item.title: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

Description: How to add up black marks on your [PI] Server
Difficulty: About 2/10
Assumed Knowledge: How to use CTRL+F button, how to paste, copy, etc…

Tested on: Project Insanity
Classes Modified: Commands.java, playersave.java, and player.java.

Okay lets get started, First off you want to open up player.java and find,

And directly above that add,

Next open up, playersave.java and find,

break; case 3: if (token.equals("character-equip")) { p.playerEquipment[Integer.parseInt(token3[0])] = Integer.parseInt(token3[1]); p.playerEquipmentN[Integer.parseInt(token3[0])] = Integer.parseInt(token3[2]); }
and directly above the Break; add,

} else if (token.equals("Black-marks")) { p.BlackMarks = Integer.parseInt(token2); }
Next (same file playersave.java) Find,

and above that, add this where you think it should go.

characterfile.write("Black-marks = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.BlackMarks), 0, Integer.toString(p.BlackMarks).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Next open up your commands.java, and add this command

if (playerCommand.startsWith("mark") && c.playerRights >= 1) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.BlackMarks++; c2.sendMessage("You've recieved a black mark from " + c.playerName + "! You now have "+ c2.BlackMarks+"."); c.sendMessage("You have given @red@" + c2.playerName + "@bla@ a blackmark."); if(c2.BlackMarks >= 5) { Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan); Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan); Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true; } } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Online."); } }
And i believe thats it, if i missed anything or if you have errors post them below,
Also this my first tutorial ever.

Read full topic
item.source: Project Insanity, adding a Black-Mark system
